title: Principal Environmental and Social Policy Specialist(Based in Beijing)
Associate / Senior Associate, Climate Change and Sustainability Services, Assurance
Advisory - Consulting, ESG Consulting | Off-Cycle Internship 2026 (Jul 2026 - Dec 2026)
description:
**Function(s):** Advisory

**Work Type:** Internship

**Start Date for Applications:** 5 Feb 2026

**Closing Date for Applications:**

KPMG in Singapore is part of a global organization of independent professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 138 countries and territories with more than 276,000 partners and employees working in member firms around the world. Each KPMG firm is a legally distinct and separate entity and describes itself as such. KPMG International Limited is a private English company limited by guarantee. KPMG International Limited and its related entities do not provide services to clients.

Job Description

KPMG in Singapore commenced work on ESG-related engagements as early as 2002, making it one of the first Big 4 firms to advise companies on their ESG journey in Singapore. The KPMG ESG team has the mission of driving large‐scale economic transformation in Singapore and the region associated with the green transition. Built on strong connectivity within local and regional markets, as well as with KPMG’s Global and Regional ESG Centres of Excellence, the KPMG ESG team houses highly technical ESG competencies and brings together best practices, all of which are directed to the co‐creation of shared value with our business partners and clients.

  

The KPMG ESG team also supports functional professionals across audit, tax and advisory with proposals in this area from the bid stage and through to delivery. This involves helping teams in Singapore as well as other member firms to drive pursuit execution, form a strategic response and pitch for our largest and most important opportunities globally, followed by delivery support where required.

  

We work on ESG reporting, strategy, and other ESG-related advisory projects such as sustainable finance and ESG due diligence. We study trends to understand future directions of ESG in different industries and advise our clients as to the adequacy and effectiveness of their measures and strategy considerations. In light of the growing demands for climate change and ESG-related services, we are looking for an intern to join our KPMG ESG team.

  

**Together with a team of ESG and other professionals within the firm, you will:**

* Position KPMG as a leading firm for ESG services in Singapore and Southeast Asia, in collaboration with other Global and Regional ESG Centres of Excellence as well as cross-functional teams to ensure we have integrated and end-to-end offerings.
* Support business development activities including the development of proposals as well as thought leadership pieces, and other industry-driven engagements.
* Support the development and delivery of service offerings in areas such as:
* ESG reporting, including gathering and collating relevant data on company’s ESG metrics, conducting market research on industry reporting landscapes, and performing gap analyses against common reporting frameworks which may include those published by the Greenhouse Gas Protocol, the Carbon Disclosure Sustainability Accounting Standards Board, the International Integrated Reporting Council Framework, the Taskforce on Climate-related Financial Disclosures, the Taskforce on Nature-based Financial Disclosures, the International Sustainability Standards Board, the Global Reporting Initiative, the Sustainability Accounting Standards Board;
* Other ESG advisory services relating to ESG reporting, including climate risk-related procedures such as scenario analysis, implementation of processes and controls to support high quality non-financial reporting, reviews of governance and risk frameworks and capacity-building workshops.
* Support the team in delivery of client engagements, ensuring high quality service and building relationships with a client-for-life approach, including:
* Conducting desktop research on market and industry trends, including topics listed above
* Assisting in data analysis and presentation preparation
* Participating in relevant brainstorming sessions to generate market / industry insights
* Coordinating with internal stakeholders on meeting / activity arrangements
* Participating and assisting in team projects and other ad hoc duties assigned
* Supporting in operational and administration tasks

⠀

**We are looking for a passionate and purposeful individual(s) who:**

* Is strongly passionate about ESG issues and committed to making a difference in the corporate landscape.
* For interns who can commit for at least 24 weeks, we welcome candidates preferably pursuing a PhD/ Master’s in Sustainability, Developmental Finance, Economics, Environmental Sciences, Social Sciences, Engineering
* For interns who can commit for 8 – 10 weeks, we welcome candidates preferably pursuing a bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Business, Finance, Environmental Science, or Social Science.
* Has excellent knowledge of MS office, especially MS PowerPoint and Excel, and is adept at developing presentation materials to a high quality with a short turnaround.
* Has excellent interpersonal and communication (written and spoken) skills, enjoys working with people and is able to build relationships with and manage a range of different stakeholders, both external and internal.
* Is of a curious temperament, independent in learning, and a self-starter with good analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Has effective project management skills and is able to multi-task to deliver on varying priorities within a highly pressured and often shifting environment
* Position KPMG as a leading firm for ESG services in Singapore and Southeast Asia, in collaboration with other Global and Regional ESG Centres of Excellence as well as cross-functional teams to ensure we have integrated and end-to-end offerings.

Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted by KPMG Talent Acquisition team, personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.
  
  
At KPMG in Singapore we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We believe that diversity of thought, background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people, our clients and communities. As an equal opportunity employer, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, race, gender identity or expression, colour, marital status, religion, sexual orientation, disability, or other non-merit factors. We celebrate the different talents that our people bring and support every staff member in their journey to achieve personal and professional growth. One of the ways we do this is through Take Charge: Flexi-work, our flexible working framework which enables agile and innovative teams to help deliver our business goals.
company_description: At KPMG, you'll be able to tap into your skills, expertise and passion to help organizations find sustainable solutions to the world's most pressing issues.

title: Advisory - Consulting, ESG Consulting | Off-Cycle Internship 2026 (Jul 2026 - Dec 2026)
Advisory - Consulting, ESG | Off-Cycle Internship (Jan 2026 to Jun 2026)
Associate, Impact and Partnerships, Corporate Affairs & Communication (CAC)
description:
**Location:**Singapore, SG

**Job Function:** Corporate Affairs & Communication

**Job Type:** Permanent

**Req ID:** 16979

GIC is one of the world’s largest sovereign wealth funds. With over 2,000 employees across 11 locations around the world, we invest in more than 40 countries globally across asset classes and businesses. Working at GIC gives you exposure to an extraordinary network of the world’s industry leaders. As a leading global long-term investor, we Work at the Point of Impact for Singapore’s financial future, and the communities we invest in worldwide.

  

**Corporate Affairs and Communications**

The Corporate Affairs and Communications (CAC) department is responsible for managing corporate affairs, branding and reputation, and all internal and external communications. It includes GIC’s interface with key stakeholders, including the general public and media.

  

**Impact and Partnerships**  
The Impact and Partnerships team empowers our employees to contribute meaningfully to build resilient and liveable communities in the markets that we operate in. We design and manage a portfolio of programmes to facilitate meaningful employee volunteering, as well as collaborate with community partners to create lasting impact through long-term initiatives.  
In this role, you will plan and run a diverse portfolio of social impact programmes focused on supporting vulnerable and under-served communities through three core pillars: tackling the impact of climate change, advancing health and well-being, and championing Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI). You will act as a bridge between GIC’s global workforce and our community partners, ensuring that GIC employees can be meaningfully involved to help meet needs in the community.

  

**What will you do as an Associate, Impact and Partnerships?**

  

Programme Management and Execution

* Actively manage GIC’s long-term Impact Programmes with Singapore-based partners
* Support the running of ‘With Love, GIC,’ our global employee volunteering programme, which includes curating meaningful opportunities for staff to contribute their time and skills
* Support the implementation of the global donation-matching programme for disaster and humanitarian relief efforts by evaluating events and preparing proposals
* Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of programmes to ensure they meet their objectives

  

Employee Engagement and Communication

* Foster a culture of giving by organising large-scale volunteer events in Singapore
* Collaborate with local teams in global offices for in-market volunteering events
* Work closely with other GIC teams to communicate GIC’s social impact efforts on both external and internal platforms

  

Stakeholder Management

* Build and maintain strong relationships with community partners, government bodies, as well as key internal stakeholders

  

What makes you a successful candidate?

* Detail-oriented and with strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyse data to evaluate the impact of engagement strategies and programmes
* Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple workstreams, track progress, and coordinate across geographies and time zones with minimal supervision
* Demonstrated ability to develop and maintain effective networks with internal and external stakeholders, in a global company
* Strong interpersonal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey ideas clearly and concisely and in an engaging manner
* Self-motivated individual with strong initiative and integrity who excels in a fast-paced environmeny
* Interest in and knowledge of the social impact sector, which includes charities, non-profits, social enterprises, philanthropic organisations, and coordinating bodies, as well as frameworks and industry best practices
* Some experience in social impact and/or volunteering

  

**Work at the Point of Impact**  
We need to be forward-looking to attract the right people to help us become the Leading Global Long-term Investor. Join our ambitious, agile, and diverse teams - be empowered to push boundaries and pursue innovative ideas, share your views, and be heard. Be anchored on our PRIME Values: Prudence, Respect, Integrity, Merit and Excellence, which guides us in how we make our day-to-day decisions. We strive to inspire. To make an impact.

  

**Flexibility at GIC**  
At GIC, our offices are vibrant hubs for ideation, professional growth, and interpersonal connection. At the same time, we believe that flexibility allows us to do our best work and be our best selves. Thus, our teams come into the office four days per week to harness the benefits of in-person collaboration but have the flexibility to choose which days they work from home and adjust this arrangement as situational needs arise.

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer**  
GIC is an equal opportunity employer, and we value diversity. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.
company_description: At GIC, we have one purpose: to generate good returns for present and future generations of Singaporeans, while benefiting the local communities we invest in around the world.

title: Sr. Director, Environmental Health & Safety, APAC
description:
**About Vantage Data Centers**
==============================

Vantage Data Centers powers, cools, protects and connects the technology of the world’s well-known hyperscalers, cloud providers and large enterprises. Developing and operating across North America, EMEA and Asia Pacific, Vantage has evolved data center design in innovative ways to deliver dramatic gains in reliability, efficiency and sustainability in flexible environments that can scale as quickly as the market demands.

**Position Summary**
--------------------

Vantage Data Centers is seeking a dynamic leader to serve as Senior Director of Environmental Health & Safety (EHS) for the APAC region- This leadership role is pivotal in shaping and executing our regional safety strategy, fostering a proactive safety culture, and aligning EHS initiatives with business growth and innovation.

You will lead a high-performing regional safety team, engage with internal and external stakeholders—including executives, customers, and vendors, and drive strategic safety initiatives across our data centers and construction sites. This role demands a blend of technical EHS expertise, strategic thinking, and executive presence.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* Serve as the primary EHS liaison for APAC-based customers, vendors, and executive stakeholders.
* Build and mentor a high-performing regional EHS team, fostering leadership growth and technical excellence.
* Shape and execute regional safety strategy in alignment with global business objectives.
* Present safety performance metrics and strategic recommendations to executive leadership.
* Ensure compliance with APAC regulatory frameworks and navigate multi-country operational challenges.
* Champion a culture of safety innovation and proactive risk management.
* Lead EHS Managers and safety consultants in the region to implement and drive the Vantage safety program across project sites and operational facilities.
* Manage the EHS Third Party Risk Management program and vet contractor EHS programs.
* Conduct audits, inspections, and reviews of safe work practices to ensure compliance with regulations and company policies.
* Support incident investigations and root cause analysis, ensuring corrective and preventive actions are implemented and communicated globally.
* Deliver regulatory training programs and monitor evolving standards to assure compliance and proactive risk management.
* Analyze safety metrics and communicate results to leadership to drive action and accountability.
* Drive a standardized and harmonized approach across the Vantage global portfolio to maximize efficiency and effectiveness.

**Technical Domains of Responsibility**
---------------------------------------

* Electrical Safety (Energized Electrical Work, Arc Flash, NFPA 70E)
* Control of Hazardous Energy (Lockout/Tagout)
* Occupational Noise Exposure & Control
* Heat Stress & Illness Prevention
* Exposure Assessment (Industrial Hygiene)
* Emergency Response Planning
* Working at Heights
* Confined Space Entry
* Heavy Material Handling
* Powered Industrial Trucks (Forklifts)
* Construction-Related Risks (Cranes/Rigging, Trenching/Shoring, MEWPs)
* Fire/Life Safety
* Hazardous Substances Handling
* Waste Management
* Spill Prevention Control and Countermeasures (SPCC)
* Risk Assessment and Mitigation Methodology
* 3rd Party Safety Supplier Management

**Qualifications**
------------------

* Minimum of 15+ years of progressive EHS experience across multiple sites.
* Proven leadership and team-building capabilities.
* Executive presence and ability to influence senior stakeholders.
* Strong understanding of APAC health and safety regulations.
* NEBOSH diploma or equivalent advanced safety/risk management certification.
* Experience in strategic planning, data analysis, and performance improvement.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with rapidly evolving infrastructure and operations.

We operate with No Ego and No Arrogance. We work to build each other up and support one another, appreciating each other’s strengths and respecting each other’s weaknesses. We find joy in our work and each other, actively seeking opportunities to inject fun into what we do. Our hard and efficient work is rewarded with an above market total compensation package. We offer a comprehensive suite of health and welfare, retirement, and paid leave benefits exceeding local expectations.

Throughout the year, the advantage of being part of the Vantage team is evident with an array of benefits, recognition, training and development, and the knowledge that your contribution adds value to the company and our community.

Don't meet all the requirements? Please still apply if you think you are the right person for the position. We are always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.

Vantage Data Centers is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Vantage Data Centers does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm agencies. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired; such resumes will be deemed the sole property of Vantage Data Centers.

title: Volunteer: Environmental Multimedia Programme in Peru
Intern, Corporate Social Responsibility
description:
About Us

CapitaLand Group (CapitaLand) is one of Asia’s largest diversified real estate groups. Headquartered in Singapore, CapitaLand’s portfolio focuses on real estate investment management and real estate development, and spans across more than 270 cities in over 45 countries.

Job Description

At CapitaLand, we believe in making a positive impact by building resilience through enriching lives and uplifting communities where we operate. CapitaLand Hope Foundation (CHF), the philanthropic arm of CapitaLand Group, was established in 2005 to deepen the company’s community development commitment and contribute towards education, health and well-being initiatives targeting children, youth and seniors. Going beyond donations, the company also advocates volunteerism as an integral part of building a caring and inclusive community. We actively leverage our resources and networks to galvanise our staff, business partners and tenants to build an ecosystem of doing good together, amplifying the direct impact of our contributions to the communities.

The Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) Intern will be part of the Group CSR Team to work with like-minded individuals to drive social impact across CapitaLand Group of businesses as part of our global efforts to be an advocate for the social causes that we are passionate about.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

* Assist in the in the planning and execution of CSR/CHF initiatives in Singapore, including the coordination with internal stakeholders, community partners and volunteers in programme design, ensuring alignment with funding focus areas, and tracking programme outcomes during implementation
* Assist in the implementation of business improvement initiatives including digitalisation of business processes, data cleaning and management
* Assist in the content development, design and management of CSR/CHF communications materials such as videos, website, intranet, promotional literature, EDMs and presentation slides, as well as support the collection of impact stories to drive social awareness and support for the causes
* Assist with CSR/CHF report preparation including data collection and analysis
* Any duties assigned

Do you have what it takes?

* Team player with good communication, interpersonal and organisation skills
* Curious, resourceful and meticulous with good analytical skills and ability to multitask and manage multiple timelines independently
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with good command of English. Knowledge of Chinese language will be advantageous when liaising with stakeholders in China if required
* Good digital media and IT knowledge and skills such as basic design tool and MS Office – Word, Excel and Powerpoint, and able to create good presentation content for reporting and storytelling
* Great project and event management experience and skills will be useful
* Strong interest in CSR and community development with some community service experience will be beneficial
* Able to commit for at least 6 months for the internship will be preferred

Closing Statement:

At CapitaLand, we advocate fair employment practices, and recruit talents based on merit and fit with our Corporate values. We provide equal opportunity for all qualified persons and build an inclusive workplace regardless of race, gender, age, religious belief or nationality.

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
company_description: Headquartered and listed in Singapore, CapitaLand is one of Asia’s largest diversified real estate groups, with a portfolio spanning across more than 240 cities in over 30 countries.
